Description: Fragment of round handle at neck join from a Brindisi pottery transport amphora. Clay fine micaceous red-brown; dull cream surface. Rectangular stamp at top of handle with Latin inscription.
Curator's comments: Name Baton. cf. Desy, Ph., Les timbres amphoriques de l'Apulie republicaine (Oxford 1989) 172. P. Palazzo, Le anfore di Apani (Brindisi), Rome 2013, 97, A1. Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 121, 17?
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1296)
